Regarding patient 'D': Patient D was categorized as an SPD (sporadic Parkinson's disease) patient.

Based on the "Patients and Methods" section, under "Subjects" (page 2):
"The study subjects were [...] 433 Japanese SPD patients (AAO [age at disease onset], 47.2 Â± 12.9 years; range, 5-88 years) selected from the gene bank of Juntendo University."

This indicates that for the group of SPD patients included in the study (to which Patient D belongs), the range for age at disease onset was 5 to 88 years. Therefore, the lower age limit for study inclusion, based on the age at disease onset for SPD patients, was 5 years.
question: Regarding patient 'D': What is the lower age limit for study inclusion (if any)?
